[An highway to greenness]

The automotive sector is typically referred to as one of the most impacting industries. And even though many brands are now electrifying their fleet, this process doesn't come with its caveats.

Today, most car brands make use of more subtle visual or narrative strategies to associate their models to the concept of sustainability in their adverts. There are plenty of techniques to do this—which are not always used together—and they are usually applied in the same way.

So, we took the YouTube adverts of 90 models of three different propulsion types (petrol, hybrid, and electric) made by different historic and new brands in the European market.

We analysed them one by one.

We were able to identify different strategies, which are usually difficult to pinpoint or recognise by just looking at the adverts normally.

But when you extract the clips containing them, they become much more visible.

[Final name] is archive in which you will be able to view these strategies just by themselves, so that a comparison between different models can be made and patterns become easy to recognise.
